subject: Sales
title: The Power of Walking Away
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Walking Away.

hook.text: A buyer stands up and heads toward the door. The seller caves in ten seconds flat.

buildup.text: Walking away is the strongest move in any negotiation. It proves you have alternatives.

discovery.text: It triggers loss aversion. The other side suddenly faces losing the entire deal, not just a term.

twist.text: But you must mean it. A bluff walk-away that gets called destroys your credibility forever.

climax.text: Willingness to leave isn't aggressive. It's honest. You're saying this deal isn't good enough yet.

punchline.text: The person willing to leave always has the edge.

quiz.question: Why is walking away so powerful in negotiation?
options: It triggers loss aversion in the other side
